question: what is this class about ?
answer:
This class, CS210, focuses on data structures and algorithms, using an object-oriented programming language, specifically C++. You will learn about various data structures like arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, binary search trees, balanced trees, and hash tables, as well as an introduction to graphs. A key component of the course is analyzing and measuring the complexities of algorithms and writing generic, reusable C++ code.

Key details:
Focus Areas: Data structures (arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, binary search trees, balanced trees, hash tables, graphs) and algorithm analysis.
 Programming Language: C++ (using CLion).
* Learning Outcomes: Analyze algorithm complexities, write generic C++ code, understand OOP concepts (inheritance, interfaces, polymorphism, abstract data types), and apply design principles to software construction.
